Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • Card
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Card>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PremiumCard

    public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Card>
    ..
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Card()
      Default Constructor, sets card power and toughness to random values between MIN and MAX contraints.
      Card(int num)
      Constructor, takes an int argument that sets both power and toughness to that argument.
      Card(int power, int toughness)
      Constructor, takes 2 int arguments to set both power and toughness values seperately.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void boost()
      Permanently increases this card's current power and toughness by 10%, rounded.
      int compareTo(Card other)
      Compares by cost first, then power, then toughness
      int getCost()
      Getter, returns the card's cost based on its power and toughness
      int getPower()
      Getter, returns the card's power level
      int getToughness()
      Getter, returns the card's toughness level
      static int randomInt(int min, int max)
      Returns a random int between min and max inclusive.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the card's power and toughness in string form
      void weaken()
      Permanently lowers this card's current power and toughness by 10%, rounded.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card()
        Default Constructor, sets card power and toughness to random values between MIN and MAX contraints. (Default is 1 - 1000 inclusive for both).

      • Card

        public Card(int num)
        Constructor, takes an int argument that sets both power and toughness to that argument.
        Parameters:
        num - The value for both card power and toughness
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if num < MIN or num > MAX
        Precondition:
        Num needs to be within MIN-MAX constraints for both power and toughness
        Postcondition:
        Sets internal power and toughness values to num value

      • Card

        public Card(int power,
            int toughness)
        Constructor, takes 2 int arguments to set both power and toughness values seperately.
        Parameters:
        power - The value for card power
        toughness - The value for card toughness
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if power < MIN or power > MAX
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if toughness < MIN or toughness > MAX
        Precondition:
        Power needs to be within MIN-MAX constraints for power, Toughness needs to be within MIN-MAX constraints for toughness
        Postcondition:
        Sets internal power and toughness values

    • Method Detail

      • getPower

        public int getPower()
        Getter, returns the card's power level
        Returns:
        The card's power level

      • getToughness

        public int getToughness()
        Getter, returns the card's toughness level
        Returns:
        The card's toughness level

      • getCost

        public int getCost()
        Getter, returns the card's cost based on its power and toughness
        Returns:
        ceiling( square root( power * 1.5 + toughness * 0.9 ) )

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the card's power and toughness in string form
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String in form of "[power/toughness]"

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Card other)
        Compares by cost first, then power, then toughness
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Card>
        Returns:
        String in form of "[power/toughness]"

      • weaken

        public void weaken()
        Permanently lowers this card's current power and toughness by 10%, rounded.

      • boost

        public void boost()
        Permanently increases this card's current power and toughness by 10%, rounded.

      • randomInt

        public static int randomInt(int min,
                            int max)
        Returns a random int between min and max inclusive.
        Parameters:
        min - Minimum int value
        max - Maximum int value
        Returns:
        An integer between min and max inclusive
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if min > max
        Precondition:
        Min must be less or equal to Max
        Postcondition:
        Returns an int between min and max inclusive
